intro: Tithymalus macrocarpus, commonly known as the large-fruited tithymalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia and the Philippines. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its fruits are distinctive, being large, dry, and covered in fine hairs. Tithymalus macrocarpus is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
